item.description: KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#1664; 09:59PM; 3714 W Oakwood Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3ELYJXC; #EastHollywood; Just 200 feet from the front doors of Fire Station 6, firefighters arrived to find a vacant (boarded up) one-story home with heavy fire showing. It took 34 firefighters 27 minutes to extinguish the flames and protect nearby residential buildings. No reported injuries. The cause of the fire is under investigation.; FS 6; Batt 11; Central Bureau; Council District 13; BC11 E20 E203 E211 E35 E52 E6 RA52 RA6 T11 T3; CH9; 13 14; Nicholas Prange

Structure Fire; INC#1664; 09:32PM; 3676 W Oakwood Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3Z7HkAX; #EastHollywood; One-story single family home with heavy fire showing. Offensive mode. ; FS 6; Batt 11; Central Bureau; Council District 13; BC11 E20 E211 E35 RA6 T11; CH9; 13; Nicholas Prange

Update Debris Flow; INC#0432; 09:30AM; 13150 W Mulholland Dr; MAP: https://bit.ly/3IXP6HI; #BeverlyCrest; LAFD Firefighters discovered one of several terraced retaining walls on a one-third acre residential property gave way, causing mud to cascade downhill, away from a 2,415 square-foot home, and onto nearby Mulholland Drive. There was no entrapment and no injuries have been reported. As the damaged retaining wall was 50' downhill from the residence, the home was not directly damaged. As a precaution, an elder male resident and his caretaker have been calmly evacuated from the premises, and are temporarily staying with a neighbor. #LATRraffic: Because the debris flow is threatening a power pole and mud remains on Mulholland Drive, that mountain top thoroughfare will remain fully closed between Coldwater Canyon Avenue (on the east) and Deep Canyon Drive (on the west) until L.A. City agencies can comprehensively assess and address the situation. Motorists should expect congestion, avoid the immediate area and monitor traffic reports on news radio. Though there has been strong rainstorm activity in the area, the Fire Department cannot determine the specific cause of the debris flow. LAFD Public Information Officer Captain Erik Scott is en route to assist the media, with an ETA of 10:00 AM.; FS 108; Batt 14; Valley Bureau; Council District 5; AO1 AO2 BC10 BC14 E108 E287 E288 E89 E90 E99 EM14 H3 H4 HA3 HA4 HR3 PI1 RA878 RA88 RA889 RA89 RA99 SC1 SQ87 SW88 T87 T88 UA2 UR88 UR89; CH8; 17; Brian Humphrey

Debris Flow; INC#0432; 08:37AM; 13150 W Mulholland Dr; MAP: https://bit.ly/3IXP6HI; #BeverlyCrest; PRELIM: LAFD Firefighters have discovered a mud and debris flow that is threatening and/or has damaged one or more homes and has compromised at least one power utility pole. No injury or physical entrapment has been reported. Occupants of homes nearest the incident are being calmly evacuated as a precaution. #LATRaffic: Until the issues are comprehensively assessed and addressed by L.A. City agencies, Mulholland Drive will be closed to all traffic between Deep Canyon Drive and Coldwater Canyon Avenue. Motorists, expect congestion and delay, avoid the immediate area and consider an alternate route. Monitor traffic reports on news radio.; FS 108; Batt 14; Valley Bureau; Council District 5; BC10 BC14 E108 E287 E288 E89 E99 EM14 H3 H4 HA3 HA4 HR3 RA878 RA88 RA889 RA89 RA99 SC1 SQ87 SW88 T87 T88 UR88 UR89 ; CH 8; 17; Brian Humphrey

Agency Assist; INC#1430; 04:42PM; Angels Gate; MAP: https://bit.ly/37sUSxv; #PortOfLosAngeles; PRELIM: LAFD maritime response to assist L.A. Port Police and Coroner in the recovery of human remains. Unknown age, gender, body condition, attire, port or vessel affiliation, or circumstances. Media Inquiries: L.A. Port Police and Coroner.; FS 111; Batt 6; South Bureau; Council District 15; BC6 BT1 BT2 BT5 E112; CH7; 14; Brian Humphrey

title.a: Update Traffic Collision with Entrapment 02/26/2023 INC#1453

item.description: Update Traffic Collision with Entrapment; INC#1453; 08:27PM; 11482 W Magnolia Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3uAKFIu; #NorthHollywood; Two vehicle collision with one vehicle overturned on surface streets, at the bottom of the Magnolia Boulevard offramp of the northbound Hollywood (SR170) Freeway. 4 patients total (3 adults and 1 infant), including a 40 year-old male and a 35 year-old female, both badly trapped in the wreckage of the same vehicle, before being freed and transported by LAFD Paramedics to a regional Trauma Center, both in critical condition. From that same vehicle came a 10 month old infant (undetermined gender), who was not trapped. That infant was taken by LAFD Paramedics to a Pediatric Trauma Center in undetermined condition. The fourth patient was an adult female from the other vehicle, taken by LAFD Paramedics to an area hospital in fair condition. Media Inquiries (Investigatory Jurisdiction To Be Determined) CHP West Valley (Log #2529) and/or LAPD Valley Traffic Division (Incident #3194).; FS 60; Batt 14; Valley Bureau; Council District 2; BC14 E102 E260 E60 E86 EM11 EM14 EM17 HR3 RA60 RA76 RA78 RA86 RA860 RA97 T60 UR88; CH8; 18; Brian Humphrey

Traffic Collision with Entrapment; INC#1453; 07:04PM; 5200 N Tujunga Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3KBL9d6; #NorthHollywood; PRELIM: Two vehicle collision with one vehicle overturned. 3 patients total (2 adults 1 child) with at least one person trapped and in critical condition. ; FS 60; Batt 14; Valley Bureau; Council District 2; BC14 E102 E260 E60 E86 EM11 EM14 HR3 RA60 RA76 RA78 RA86 T60 UR88; CH8; 18; Brian Humphrey

River Rescue; INC#0557; 09:25AM; 11200 Oro Vista Ave; MAP: https://bit.ly/3ZpLTGy; #Sunland; PRELIM: LAFD ground and air response to two adults (age/gender/affiliation undetermined) and one pet cat noted by a passerby to be (long-term) camping in a vehicle on dry land in a remote section of the otherwise now stormwater-filled Tujunga Wash at the base of the San Gabriel Mountains. Though in no imminent physical peril, the pair exhibited signs of hypothermia upon LAFD contact, and accepted an offer of medical care. The trio have been hoisted into a hovering LAFD Rescue Helicopter, which will transport them directly to an area hospital for further evaluation.; FS 74; Batt 12; Valley Bureau; Council District 7; AO1 AO2 BC12 E24 E274 E288 E474 E8140 H3 H5 HA3 HA5 RA74 RA874 SC1 SW44 SW88 T74 T88 UR88; CH 8; Brian Humphrey

Update Traffic Collision; INC#2033; 08:58PM; 6840 N Kester Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3IVhFWs; #VanNuys; Patient was a 75 year-old male, the driver and sole occupant of sedan that struck the exterior wall of and entered one first floor unit of a 18,333 square foot two-story 20-unit apartment building. No fire. No entrapment. The patient sustained an arm injury, and was transported by LAFD Paramedics to a regional trauma center in fair condition. No other injuries reported. LA Dept of Building & Safety is on site evaluating the structure. The cause of the collision remains under active investigation by LAPD Valley Traffic Division (Incident #3330).; FS 39; Batt 10; Valley Bureau; Council District 6; E239 E288 E88 RA39 RA81 RA88 T39 T88 UR88; CH8; 17; Brian Humphrey

Traffic Collision; INC#2033; 07:36PM; 6840 N Kester Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3IVhFWs; #VanNuys; PRELIM: Solo vehicle into apartment building. No fire. No entrapment. Unspecified Damage. Vehicle driver (unknown age / gender / condition) en route to area hospital by LAFD ambulance. LAFD Urban Search and Rescue unit deployed to perform preliminary structural evaluation/stabilization. LA Dept of Building & Safety en route. ETA 9:00 PM. Media Inquiries: LAPD Valley Traffic Division (Incident #3330); FS 39; Batt 10; Valley Bureau; Council District 6; E239 RA39 RA81 T39 UR88; CH8; Brian Humphrey
